greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = a(2) = 1; a(n) = (a(n-1) + 1)/a(n-2) (for n>2, n odd), (a(n-1)^2 + 1)/a(n-2) (for n>2, n even).
comment: Any sequence a(1),a(2),a(3),... defined by the recurrence a(n) = (a(n-1)+1)/a(n-2) (for n>2, n odd), (a(n-1)^2+1)/a(n-2) (for n>2, n even) has period 6. The theory of cluster algebras currently being developed by Fomin and Zelevinsky gives a context for these facts, but it doesn't really explain them in an elementary way. - _James Propp_, Nov 20 2002
Terms of the simple continued fraction of 43/[3*sqrt(434)-37]. Decimal expansion of 16076/142857. - _Paolo P. Lava_, Aug 05 2009
link: Sergey Fomin and Andrei Zelevinsky, Cluster algebras II: Finite type classification, arXiv:math/0208229 [math.RA], 2002-2003.
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,0,0,0,0,1).
maple: a := 1; b := 1; f := proc(n) option remember; global a,b; if n=1 then RETURN(a); fi; if n=2 then RETURN(b); fi; if n mod 2 = 1 then RETURN((f(n-1)+1)/f(n-2)); fi; RETURN((f(n-1)^2+1)/f(n-2)); end;
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 21 2002
